title_as_recorded: Decretals of Gregory IX, commentary on
former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.
note: ff. 1-2v: F. 2 is somewhat smaller: 159 x 127 mm.|ff. 1-2v: Latin.|ff. 1-2v: Unidentified commentary (casus) on the Decretals of Gregory IX, liber I, titulus III, capitula VIII-XV and XXXII-XLIII; not the casus attached to the Decretals in the Ordinary Gloss on the text; not Innocent IV's commentary on the Decretals.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.
physical_description: Script, ff. 1-2v: Caroline minuscule.|Layout, ff. 1-2v: 26 long lines; the center bifolium of a gathering.
note: Bibliography: G. Ecker, Descriptive Catalog of the Carolingian Manuscripts in Conception Abbey Library (unpublished), pp. 25-30.|ff. 1-2v: F. 2 is somewhat smaller: 276 x 172 mm. The red ink of the rubrics is quite faded.|ff. 1-2v: Latin.|ff. 1-2v: Contains 1 Peter 1:4-7, Matthew 16:13-19 (as incipit, "usque" and the explicit), Hebrews 12:3-9, Matthew 12:30-37, Luke 17:20-37, Luke 21:34-36, I Corinthians 13:1-13.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.
physical_description: Script, ff. 1-2v: Caroline minuscule; rustic capitals.
note: Bibliography: G. Ecker, Descriptive Catalog of the Carolingian Manuscripts in Conception Abbey Library (unpublished), pp. 31-36.|ff. 1-2v: Latin.|ff. 1-2v: Contains readings for Easter week; the bifolium is folded the wrong way so that Friday and Saturday services preceed Monday and Tuesday physically; the corrected order is followed in numbering the leaves in this description.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.
physical_description: Other decoration, f. 1r-v: Red initials with yellow and green decoration.|Script, f. 1r-v: Caroline minuscule.|Music, f. 1r-v: Interlinear neumes.
note: Manuscript note: From same codex as CA 07.|Bibliography: G. Ecker, Descriptive Catalog of the Carolingian Manuscripts in Conception Abbey Library (unpublished), pp. 37-40.|f. 1r-v: Latin.|f. 1r-v: Contains versicle and hymn for first vespers of Passion Sunday, the Magnificat antiphon, the invitatory (from Psalm 94) with neumes, the vesper oration; the hymn at matins (Pange Lingua), and the first lesson at matins with its responsory, with neumes.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.

Ecker, Descriptive Catalog of the Carolingian Manuscripts in Conception Abbey Library (unpublished), pp. 41-43.|f. 1r-v: Latin.|f. 1r-v: Contains John 8:46-59, i.e. the final reading for the third nocturn at matins on Passion Sunday; antiphons and hymn (Lustra sex), with neumes, for lauds.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.
physical_description: Script, f. 1r-v: Caroline minuscule.

Ecker, Descriptive Catalog of the Carolingian Manuscripts in Conception Abbey Library (unpublished), pp. 44-46.|f. 1r-v: Holes in the parchment from its use in a binding; stitched repairs in green thread.|f. 1r-v: Latin.|f. 1r-v: Contains the three prayers for the mass of Peter and Paul (29 June) and a preface proper to the saints; beginning of the preface for the feast of Thomas apostle (21 December).
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.

acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.

physical_description: Script, ff. 1-2v: Pregothic.|Music, ff. 1-2v: Interlinear neumes.

Ecker, Descriptive Catalog of the Carolingian Manuscripts in Conception Abbey Library (unpublished), pp. 57-66.|ff. 1-2v: F. 2 is somewhat smaller: 330 x 197 mm.|ff. 1-2v: Latin.|ff. 1-2v: On f. 1r-v: Septuagesima Sunday, Wednesday and Friday of the week; f. 2r-v: masses for the feast of Juliana (16 Feb), the Chair of Peter (22 Feb), Mathias (24 Feb), Perpetua and Felicitas (6 Mar), Gregory pope (12 Mar), Annunciation (25 Mar).|Explicit, ff. 1-2v: Gregory pope (12 Mar), Annunciation (25 Mar).

physical_description: Script, f. 1r-v: Cursive.
note: f. 1r-v: Latin.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Script, ff. 1-5v: Liturgical book hand.|Layout, ff. 1-5v: 15 long lines, ruled in ink, with vertical bounding lines full length. Foliated in red roman numerals in the upper right corner of the recto. Running headlines across the opening.
note: ff. 1-5v: Latin.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Script, f. 1r-v: Stencil.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 19 long lines set on pale ink ruling.
note: f. 1r-v: The entire text, including capital letters and punctuation, was produced by stencil.|f. 1r-v: Latin.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Script, ff. 1-5v: Liturgical book hand.|Layout, ff. 1-5v: 14 long lines with text lines in red ink; the two horizontal bounding lines (with the latter functioning also as the last text line) are full across.
note: ff. 1-5v: Two nested bifolia and a single leaf; the bifolia are made up of singletons pasted together at the gutter.|ff. 1-5v: Latin.|ff. 1-5v: Pss. 55, 56 and 108:1-6, 23-31 (end); the break of Ps. 108:7-22 probably represents the loss of two leaves between the present ff. 4 and 5. Psalms suggest Tues. or Wedn. at matins (secular or monastic use) for Pss. 55-56; Ps. 108 is for Sat. at matins.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Price in English pounds on the recto, suggesting that the leaf may have been a gift to Conception Abbey from Dr. Charles D. Humberd (1876-1966) of Bernard, Missouri (buried in West Union, Indiana).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Script, f. 1r-v: Liturgical book hand.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 16 long lines.
note: Bibliography: De Ricci, p.|f. 1r-v: Latin.
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Came to Conception Abbey from its motherhouse, Engelberg in Switzerland.
physical_description: Script, One item, recto & verso: Gothic book hand.|Layout, One item, recto & verso: 2-column manuscript of which one column survives here.
note: One item, recto & verso: Latin.|One item, visible side: Contains John 19:36-38.|Incipit, One item, visible side: et permisit pilatus, venit ergo et tu//.|Explicit, One item, visible side: //ta sunt enim hec ut scriptura impleretur dicens Os non comminuetis ex eo . . .
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Purchased ca. 2000 from a book dealer.
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: 1-line gold initials on white-patterned particolored grounds.|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic book hand.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 16 long lines ruled in ink with the four bounding lines full length.
note: f. 1r-v: The recto foliated "150" in pencil in a modern hand.|f. 1r-v: Latin.|f. 1r-v: Contains Ps. 21:21-32, which does not occur in a book of hours; thus, although the leaf has the appearance of a book of hours, it is here catalogued as a psalter (perhaps as part of a psalter-book of hours).
acknowledgements: We thank Michael W. Heil for his work in making this description available.

former_owner_as_recorded: Brought from the library of Engelberg Abbey in Switzerland to Conception Abbey sometime before 1900.
